title: HR Analyst
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (“FMIC”) is located in Scottsdale, AZ. Our brand mission is to accompany each player at every stage with products and brand experiences that fuel the pursuit of musical expression. Within Fender Global Human Resources, we strive to provide outstanding leadership management and support to our internal clients. We specialize in all areas of HR and work hard to ensure we provide our employees with the best possible care. We are passionate about growing our global Fender Family and contributing to the overall success of our organization. We have an opportunity for an experienced HR Analyst to join our HR team based in Tokyo, Japan.
An American icon, Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence extending beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument, it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
In this role, you will support and maintain the HR Management System, SuccessFactors. This will include working extensively with all aspects of the Enterprise environment through developing and modifying programs to ensure the effective storage, retrieval, and reporting of employee data. You will serve as our technical point-of-contact and subject matter expert (“SME”) for assigned HR functional areas, while also ensuring data integrity, testing system changes, report writing, and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. You will also serve as the HR compliance auditor, responsible for the accuracy and timeliness of HR policies and procedures.
Essential Functions: 

Partner with employees and management to communicate various human resource policies, procedures, laws, standards and government regulations
Provide data to the payroll vendor on monthly basis and check the payroll data
Administer miscellaneous paperworks including social security, health insurance and tax related applications
Assist recruiting processes including interview setup, contract filing
Administer onboarding processes and conduct new hire orientation
Day to day contact for employees with benefit related questions and issues
Support annual review cycle and year end compensation process
Assist HR process closely working with global HR functional teams
Administer work hour time tracking and leave of absences by time tracking system
Point of contact for internal employee communications
Data entry into success factor closely working HRIS team in the US
Assist APAC HR specific projects

Business Knowledge, Skill Requirements, and Desired Attributes:

Excellent communication skills
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality and manage information with utmost integrity
Ability to establish rapport and credibility at all levels of the company
Passion for music!
Analytical Skills
Ability to use logical thinking and reasoning to solve a problem
Organized possessing the trait of being organized or following a systematic method of performing a task
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Applications, strong Excel spreadsheet and database programs (SAP, Success Factor)
Japanese native level, strong English communication capability in speaking and writing
Experiences in process review, system enhancement and implementation preferred

Education and/or Certifications and/or Training:

Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Computer Information Systems, Business Administration or a related field is preferred

Minimum Professional Experience:

2 – 3 years experiences in consulting firms
2 – 3 years experiences in HR (operations or generalist) 

 
About Fender Musical Instruments:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation (FMIC) is one of the world’s leading musical instrument manufacturers, marketers and distributors, whose portfolio of brands includes Fender®, Squier®, Gretsch®, Jackson®, EVH®, Charvel® and Groove Tubes®, among others. For more information, visit www.fender.com. Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veterans’ status, sexual orientation, or any other protected factor.
